channel.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge
channel.description: Get the top stories from the world of technology in 90 seconds. Hosted by a rotating cast of writers from The Verge and filled with just the right amount of what you need.
channel.itunes:author: The Verge
channel.itunes:summary: Get the top stories from the world of technology in 90 seconds. Hosted by a rotating cast of writers from The Verge and filled with just the right amount of what you need.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, June 13th, 2014 (Finale)
item.description:
I hope they are watching. They'll see. This is my gift. My curse. And for a moment, I thought we were in trouble. I do wish we could chat longer, but... I'm having an old friend for dinner. I think this is the beginning of a beautiful friendship. Now we are free. I will see you again, but not yet. Not yet.
And like that... poof... they're gone. Good night, and good luck.
Some assets courtesy of http://www.shutterstock.com

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, June 12th, 2014 (Prime Music)
item.description: He's getting stronger. We're having trouble controlling him. Ross Miller is catching on. If we don't stop him soon, we're at risk of losing this entire operation. They mustn't pass the 90th second! Tomorrow, this all comes to an end. Finish him.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, June 11th, 2014 (TweetDeck)
item.description: A massive TweetDeck outage may have been an "accident" caused by one Austrian teen's experiment, but really, the vulnerability discovered shouldn't have existed in the first place. Here's what happened and how (spoiler: javascript).

item.title: This Friday: the '90 Seconds' finale
item.description: Two years in the making. 477 episodes. All things must end. Enjoy a one-minute teaser for a two-minute-ish finale to the weirdest 90-second daily news show.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, June 10th, 2014 (Toyota)
item.description: Why do we keep saying it? It never happens! Coming up tomorrow? When was the last time that actually came true?! There's something bigger happening here! Where did everybody go?! Hello?! Is anybody there?!?

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, June 9th, 2014 (Halo)
item.description:
6865206b6e6f7773 7368757420697420646f776e
With Halo 5 still over a year away, Microsoft has put every consolation prize imaginable into one beautiful stopgap. The Master Chief Collection brings all four main Halo games to the Xbox One and early access to the Halo 5 multiplayer beta. Will this and a Ridley Scott-produced series tide people over?

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, June 3rd, 2014 (Star Wars filming)
item.description: The following is inspired by an actual conversation. "It can't be an X-Wing. Look at the nose, it's way too short." (But it clearly looks like the wings can go flap up into an X) "True, but look at the engines! There's only one engine on each side; the X-Wing has two each side!" (I mean, it's clearly not complete. Maybe they're adding more engines.) "But there's no room for more! Look how they're placed! It's not an X-Wing, but I bet it's from the same manufacturer." (The same... fictional manufacturer?) "Yeah, like, Star Wars Boeing."

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, June 2nd, 2014
item.description: The wait is over. WWDC 2014 is here. This morning, Tim Cook and his team unveiled updates to both OS X and iOS, as well as gave developers a first look at Apple's new programming language. Here is everything you need know about the event!

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, May 28th, 2014 (Mod T 3D printer)
item.description:
"Alright, I got it. I'm gonna make a 3D printer, no bigger than a bread box, and it's gonna be able to print out 3D prints of itself. And they can lock in together to make even bigger 3D things."
"Dude... I think that's how The Matrix happened."

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, May 27th, 2014
item.description: Status Thoughts: How many monkeys can really fit in a barrel? Do squirrels have nut allergies? Why does it say 91 seconds when you watch this on YouTube? If a tree falls in the woods, does it scare the smaller animals? Also where do mules come from?

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, May 23rd, 2014 (Redbox)
item.description:
"Ladies and gentlemen, I think it's time we look beyond DVD, beyond Blu-ray, and to a new physical format altogether. One that will meet our needs for years to come. The disc itself is wearing thin, no pun intended. Customers can't tell the difference between a CD and a Blu-ray at first glance. If the hold it the wrong, they can smudge or worse scratch the data away. Scratch. It. Away. And cloud? What's cloud? It's nothing tangible. My esteemed colleagues, what I hold today will last a lifetime. It's portable, you can hold it pretty much however you want, and it will stand the test of time."
"Excuse me, sir? That's a Super Nintendo cartridge."
"Exactly!"

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, May 22nd, 2014 (iMessage)
item.description: Hello? Can anyone hear me? This is Nathan and I'm stuck in the land of the lost, purgatory, limbo. Whatever you want to call it, I'm here and I'm surrounded by weird messages like, "Hey babe. U up?" and "HI JOHN ITS DAD JUST WANTED TO SAY WAT UP HAHA JK LUV U TALK 2 U SOON LOVE DAD." Please send help. I don't know how long I will last.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, May 21st, 2014 (X-Men: DOFP)
item.description: The X-Men return to theaters this week with Bryan Singer's sequel to the reboot that's now canon to an earlier trilogy that may or may not matter now. Possibly. Confused yet? Don't worry, Hugh Jackman's in it. Here's what you need to know.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, May 20th, 2014 (Twitch / YouTube)
item.description: "Anarchy! Anarchy! Anarchy!" screamed the voices in his head. The youthful trainer moves around erratically up, down, left, right. Going into his bag. Looking away from his bag. A rattata appears in a shrub near the Route 1 sign post. Out comes Squirtle, as if by instinct. "Democracy! Democracy! Tackle! Tackle!" The rattata is weak and prime for capture! "Anarhcy! Run away!" What?! The trainer thinks he might have a psychosis.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, May 19th, 2014 (AT&T / DirecTV)
item.description: I hereby approve the official merger of raspberry jelly and chunky peanut butter. Under the merger rules, the two entities must live in unity on toasted rye, as one. If either the jelly or the peanut butter exit the toasted rye and land on an article of clothing (pants, shirt, socks, etc.), the blame is to be put on both entities. If either party does not abide by these rules, the snack shall hereby be terminated.

If either the jelly or the peanut butter exit the toasted rye and land on an article of clothing (pants, shirt, socks, etc.), the blame is to be put on both entities. If either party does not abide by these rules, the snack shall hereby be terminated.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, May 16th, 2014 (Godzilla)
item.description: In 1954 Godzilla made his feature-film debut. In 1962, he fought King Kong. In 1977 he took on The Avengers and Fantastic Four. In 1985, he sold Dr Pepper. In 1992 he played basketball with Charles Barkley. In 1998, he co-starred with Matthew Broderick in a romantic comedy by Roland Emmerich. And at some point in the timeline he took his son out for a loving stroll and taught him to use atomic breath.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, May 14th, 2014 (iPhone 6 rumors)
item.description: But how will a new iPhone affect ABC's Selfie, you might ask? Wait, you're not asking that? Well too bad, because the trailer is so traumatizing, so emotionally traumatizing, that we can't think of anything else. It's apparently inspired by My Fair Lady (much like how Clueless was inspired by Jane Austen's Emma). We don't know how to feel anymore. Dammit.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, May 13th, 2014
item.description: Introducing the constantly connected, always plugged-in Xbox One with Kinect... alright, we're going to change that slightly. Introducing the constantly connected, optionally plugged-in Xbox One with Kinect... what was that? We need to update it again? Ok, we are pleased to introduce the Xbox One with Kinect that has optional connection and optional plug-in features. Perfect. We're all set... again? Ok, hopefully for the last time. Introducing the Xbox One. You can also spend an extra hundred dollars and get a Kinect.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, May 12th, 2014 (DEKA Arm)
item.description: List of things to try out with new mind-controlled prosthetic arm: zip up my sweater, unlock my front door with a key, re-lock the door, play rock-paper-scissors, play Halo 3, learn the hand jive and perform it at the next Grease convention, learn to play bass.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, May 8th, 2014 (Nintendo)
item.description: Donkey Kong: Jungle Beat of the Planet of the Apes. The Memory Card in Jail Cell A does not have a save file. (Submit to new masters) Select a stamp for your save file. Saving... Please do not turn off the console or seek help. (Clap! Clap!) Opening Ceremony. (Resist!) Nope, dammit, clap! Now bang the drums!

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, May 7th, 2014 (Alibaba IPO) - (video post)
item.description: Alibaba is coming to America, but is America ready? Are you ready? Are you even reading this? Hello? Did you just come here to watch this video? Why am I even writing this? Do you care about the description? Is it really that important? Why am I writing to an empty audience? What’s the point? Why am I only writing questions? What does that say about me? Who am I? Am I having some sort of existential crisis? Yep. I am.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, May 5th, 2014 (Dogecar)
item.description:
"It's the Dogecar machine for Josh Wise. Doge is an internet crypto currency. It's not traded in dollars but a win here would pay 596,064,147 dogecoins and a group of people on reddit.com that are NASCAR fans crowdfunded this sponsorship for Phil Parsons Racing and Josh Wise today.
"Yep I looked it up on the old Google machine and it's quite a deal he's got going on here. it could turn into something really big."

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, May 2nd, 2014 (Oculus v. ZeniMax)
item.description: So it's a virtual legal challenge, right? It's not real. (No, it's an actual legal challenge.) OK, so it's a legal challenge about reality? How philosophical! (No, it's a legal challenge about virtual reality.) Real legal challenge... virtual reality subject material. (Right.) Of virtual money? (No! Real money!) Alright alright... so do I need a headset to view the lawsuit? I get nauseous pretty easily...

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, May 1st, 2014 (Google Nexus)
item.description: If Google's premium-focused Android Silver program really does spell the end of Nexus (as rumored), then what happens to midrange? Introducing Android Bronze, a line of Xperia phones that are subsidized by adding a mustache to every selfie you take, agnostic of gender or species. Also available in copper.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, April 29th, 2014 (Star Wars cast)
item.description:
And now, a selection from Christmas in the Stars: Star Wars Christmas Album, "What Can You Get a Wookiee for Christmas (When He Already Owns a Comb?)" — yes, it's real:
Let me see. We have a scarf for Skywalker, right? (Yes!) And perfume for the Princess? (Yes, yes!) What about Han Solo? (Couldn't we get him ear muffs?) That leaves one big problem. (THE WOOKIEE!) Couldn't we get him a comb? (We gave him a comb last year!) What can you get a Wookie for christmas when he already owns a comb? ... He doesn't need a tie clip and he doesn't use shaving foam, so what can you get a Wookiee for christmas when he already owns a comb? (It's really a problem!)

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, April 28th, 2014 (Xbox Originals)
item.description: Alright we have over three million copies of 'E.T: The Extra Terrestrial' left in our warehouse. I think we need to accept the fact that the game just didn't play well. Screw it, let's just be honest with ourselves and say that the game sucked. It might even be one of the worst games I've ever played. You know what? It IS the the worst game I've ever played. I mean, how did we make something like that? It's atrocious! It's an embarrassment to Atari, Mr. Steven Spielberg, and all of your families! You should be ashamed! I'm sorry about that. I overreacted. Anyway, let's just fill a landfill in New Mexico with the rest of the copies and call it a night. Anyone want to get dinner?

item.description: Elon Musk is looking to change transportation for everyone. Wait, that's the description? That's... boring Do you have a better idea? Second, this sounds like that South Park "dude / buddy / guy" thing. Not original. Do you enjoy hearing yourself talk? item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, April 22nd, 2014 (Lytro)
item.description: Did you say the wrong thing to your significant other again? Was it something about their weight or a new outfit? Had trouble lying about liking his friends? Introducing the Polaroid Relation Camera! Next time you say the wrong thing, simply pull out the camera and snap a quick pic. Immediately following the shutter closing, 'La Vie en Rose' by Louis Armstrong begins to play. Before you know it, the two of you won't even remember what you were fighting about as you get lost in the soothing melody of this romantic tune. Coming this summer for $1999.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, April 21st, 2014
item.description: After great success with the release of the Grimace pogo stick and the Hamburglar jumprope, we are sad to announce that the McNugget Pedometer will end its run next week. While the team behind the device was and still is very proud of the device, the number of devices sold has not met our expectations. Apparently both the desire to consume the device upon purchase, as well as the "rotting" smell that tends to appear after about two days of owning the device has led to both critics and consumers being less than pleased with our product. We apologize for letting you, the customer, down. We would also like to extend a sincere apology to Mr. Ronald McDonald. We never intended to harm the McDonald name. However, we think that our next product, Hamburger Hammocks, will be a big hit!
item.media:title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, April 21st, 2014
item.media:description: After great success with the release of the Grimace pogo stick and the Hamburglar jumprope, we are sad to announce that the McNugget Pedometer will end its run next week. While the team behind the device was and still is very proud of the device, the number of devices sold has not met our expectations. Apparently both the desire to consume the device upon purchase, as well as the "rotting" smell that tends to appear after about two days of owning the device has led to both critics and consumers being less than pleased with our product. We apologize for letting you, the customer, down. We would also like to extend a sincere apology to Mr. Ronald McDonald. We never intended to harm the McDonald name. However, we think that our next product, Hamburger Hammocks, will be a big hit!

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, April 18th, 2014
item.description: Metamucil One, you’re go for take off. Remember, you will be carrying 40 tons of Metamucil, America’s number one fiber supplement. Since the creation of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, astronauts have been forced to deal with eating food that does a real number on their digestive systems. The launch of Metamucil One marks a major step forward in the NASA astronaut diet. Thank you for your patriotism.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, April 17th, 2014
item.description: Beep. Beep beep. Beep beep beep. There is a Myspace user nearby. There is a Myspace user nearby. Wait, I'm sorry. It seems the user accidentally visited Myspace when he was actually looking for a site called MyFace which determines what two people’s baby would look like. We will continue to track Myspace and alert you when someone finally logs on.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, April 16th, 2014 (Fast 7)
item.description: At Subway, we’re all about eating fresh and eating healthy. We know how difficult it can be to count calories and maintain a healthy diet. That is why we are pleased to introduce our Holographic Turkey Club. For years, we’ve pondered how to bring you all the bold, exciting flavors of a traditional Subway sandwich, but with zero calories. After many trials, we’re excited to unveil this culinary creation to our restaurants. We cannot wait for you to come in and try it yourself! Come hungry, leave happy, but still hungry because you’re not physically putting anything in your stomach.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, April 15th, 2014 (Amazon smartphone)
item.description: Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the Fifth Annual Jeff Bezos Book Burning! This year we are pleased to unveil the Kindling Fire, which is sure to put a spark in the Amazon ecosystem. Using the Kindling Fire, customers will now be able to get a book bonfire started in 60 seconds or less. Got the hardcover version of 'The Hunger Games' series? Toss it into the pit! Still holding on to the paperback version of 'Huckleberry Finn'? Burn that book! Once the event is complete, feel free to download the digital version of your library which by that point will be reduced to ashes. Have a great time everyone!

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, April 14th, 2014 (Google buys Titan)
item.description: Commander Frizzle. Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to establish a wireless signal (802.11n) to the subject's esophagus. To accomplish this, we recommend initial entry by way of the nasal cavity, as the mouth will have too much turbulence. If you run into trouble near the pharynx, it's acceptable (though not preferred) to divert course and deploy in the larynx. Plan on flying within the proximity for at least two weeks until Colonel Osmosis Jones can take over.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, April 11th, 2014 (Google Glass on sale)
item.description: With Google Glass, you can share with the world your viewpoint. With Facebook Fillings, you can share with your community everything you say the precise moment you say it. Every amazing speech, every grumpy utterance under your breath, every disturbing snippet when you talk in your sleep — all posted immediately to your public Facebook wall. The future is great!

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, April 10th, 2014 (Project Ara)
item.description: Of course, you could add a camera, more storage, an extra battery... but why not a toaster module? For breakfast, that is. Why not something that trims a beard, or mixes a cocktail? Could we nix a battery altogether in favor of a large solar panel? I don't really want to work at night anyway. How about a bug zapper?

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, April 9th, 2014
item.description: Sit back, relax, and let your supportive and loving internet service provider, Comcast, take care of you. In a matter of moments, we will begin the acquisition of your eyeballs. Do not fear, the process is actually quite simple. You won't feel a thing. Just think of it more as a partnership between our innovative company and your beautiful eyes. It works out well for all parties involved; you will gain top-of-the-line 20/20 vision and we'll get to beam advertisements for Comcast properties straight into your brain.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, April 8th, 2014
item.description: Is that a bird? A plane? Oh wait, yeah, that’s just a bird. I thought it might be Sad-Man, but he still hasn’t gotten out of bed. Perhaps today he’ll finally fight some crime! Oh, it appears he’s now putting on an Elliot Smith song and also watching Requiem for a Dream at the same time. Perhaps when it’s over he’ll get to work saving humanity. Nope, he just starting crying again and while shouting expletives about some girl named Jessica. Tune in next time for more adventures from Sad-Man!!

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, April 7th, 2014
item.description: Android TV is old news. 'Musk See TV' is in. Introducing Elon Musk's vision for the future of television. After installing your 'Musk,' simply sit down on your couch and let the box do the rest for you. ‘Musk See TV’ will beam directly into your eyes, allowing you to tilt your head back and rest it against the wall without missing a second of programming. The box also comes with a drool catcher allowing you to enter an almost comatose state without getting saliva on your shirt. Once the box decides that you have reached the maximum amount of entertainment your mind can handle, it releases you from its visual grasp and allows you to continue on with the rest of your bland existence. Be warned though…once you start using the box, there is no stopping.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, April 4th, 2014
item.description: No one will even come close to filling the hole David Letterman is leaving in late night television. However, CBS will now be tasked with finding his successor. In order to help alleviate some of that stress, we at The Verge, have some suggestions for hosts and shows: 'Dropping the Ball with Steve Ballmer,' 'The Jeff Bezos Variety Hour,' 'Chris Ziegler: Car and Pizza Talk Live from Chicago,' 'Shane Says with Michael Shane,' 'Third Eye Blind Live,' and 'Four Hours of Ross Miller Dancing.'

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, April 3rd, 2014
item.description:
"Mozilla prides itself on being held to a different standard and, this past week, we didn’t live up to it. We know why people are hurt and angry, and they are right: it’s because we haven’t stayed true to ourselves.
We didn’t act like you’d expect Mozilla to act. We didn’t move fast enough to engage with people once the controversy started. We’re sorry. We must do better."

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, April 2nd, 2014 (Fire TV)
item.description: We at Amazon are so pleased with Fire TV. It shows the true potential of our Prime video service, as well as what kind of products our remarkable team can build, but we don't want to stop there. That is why we are also announcing Amazon Prime Rib, our first step into the culinary world. With Prime Rib, you can order a fat slab of meat and have it delivered to you in just two days. Need your steak by tonight? No worries because thanks to our fleet of shipment drones, that giant hunk of juicy cow will be raining from the sky and landing right on your doorstep within the hour. We are so excited about Amazon Prime Rib and we think you'll be too.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, April 1st, 2014
item.description: Didn't make the deadline to sign up for Healthcare.gov? Have no fear because you may still be to enroll as long as you meet one of the following requirements: you experienced website errors, were given misinformation by an Affordable Care Act worker, spilled iced tea on your keyboard, had a bad hair day, woke up late for work, had a bad case of the hiccups, had a good case of the hiccups, went to the gym and got too buff, got caught in a sticky situation, or died. Thank you again for your interest in Healthcare.gov!

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, March 31st, 2014
item.description: Two households, both alike in dignity, in fair California, where we lay our scene, from ancient patent infringement to new mutiny, where civil blood makes civil hands unclean. From forth the fatal loins of these two technologically advanced foes. A pair of star-cross'd board members take their life; Whose misadventured piteous overthrows. Do with their death bury their companies' strife. The fearful passage of their death-mark'd love, And the continuance of their parents' ongoing legal battles, which, but their employees' end, nought could remove, Is now the never-ending traffic of our lawsuit; the which if you with patient jurors attend, what here shall miss, our toil shall strive to mend or possibly ban sales of the other's products.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, March 28th, 2014
item.description: Dan Seifert has vowed to eat his Blackberry Bold if Blackberry isn't profitable by 2016. While this may seem like a surprising bet to make, it's far from his first one. Previously, Dan vowed to eat his left foot if Google ever did more than just create a search engine, eat his own parents if the government ever breached our privacy, and eat his childhood memories if Facebook beat Myspace.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, March 25th, 2014
item.description: Imagine all the things you can do in virtual reality: riding a rollercoaster, riding a dinosaur, going to the movies, sitting on a virtual couch watching TV, going on virtual walks through virtual parks, shopping, brushing your teeth, taking a shower. All without ever having to leave your bed!

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, March 20th, 2014
item.description: Violation #1: The facility is in a tree which is made entirely of wood. One spark on a dry summer day and the whole place could burn to the ground. Violation #2: The magic dust is held above 41º F. Violation #3: Elves are not given an appropriate amount of snacks. Violation #4: Evidence of dragons or live dragons present in facility's food and/or non-food areas. Violation #5: Appropriately scaled metal stem-type wand not provided or used to evaluate temperatures of potentially hazardous treats during cooking, cooling, reheating and holding.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, March 14th, 2014
item.description: Get ready to hear all your favorite Disney songs, but remixed with an EDM twist! Enjoy tracks like, 'A Whole New World of Dupstep' and 'Circle of Life of Dubstep' the next time you hit the club. Perhaps you'll get down with 'Hakuna Matata That Dubstep is Crazy!' or 'It's a Small World (After All There is Dubstep).' Whatever you choose to listen to, know that it'll be full of your favorite Disney characters and very loud dubstep.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, March 13th, 2014
item.description: Two strangers. One room. Well they're not complete strangers. Let's start again. Two guys who work together, but don't usually hang out outside of the office. One room. What happens when they are told to kiss for the first time on camera? Some say it's going to be magical, some say it's going to be weird. Either way, it'll go viral.

item.description: I'm beginning to suspect that the mole is closer to me than I originally believed. Is it Ross Miller? He's been acting unusually normal lately. That's not like him. Or could it be Chris Ziegler? He recently moved to New York from Chicago and we all know that moles love deep dish pizza. Am I the mole? Have I forgotten my assignment? Oh man. I guess I'm the mole. Well, I better start snooping. Who do I work for though?

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, March 11th, 2014
item.description: How am I supposed to live without you? That was the question posed by legendary musician Michael Bolton. Now, over 30 years after he shouted those words, Michael Bolton is back, but this time he's headed to the app store. In 'Heart Catcher,' players must collect broken hearts as they fall from the clouds. Collect all the pieces of the broken heart and love will be restored. Will Michael reunite with his true love or will he forever be lost without her?

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, March 6th, 2014
item.description: Hi, this is NBA legend Charles Barkley. By now, many of you have probably heard about Shaquille O'Neal's plan to release a sequel to 'Shaq Fu.' Well looks like the ball isn't just in your court, friend. I would like to announce that I, too, am working on a sequel to my classic game, 'Barkley Shut Up and Jam!' Next year, 'Barkley II: Why Isn't Anyone Jamming With Me?' will hit stores exclusively for Super Nintendo. A lot of people have asked me, "Charles? How come you are releasing this game all by yourself and on a console that was discontinued in the late 90's?" My response is usually, "How about you put that basketball where the court is?" So buy my game and shoot some hoops with me. Please.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, March 5th, 2014
item.description: The man awoke not knowing who he was or where he was currently sitting. A cameraman, along with his trusty C100, waits patiently for the man to ready himself. The man stumbles to his feet, unsure of himself, but feeling the urge to present himself to the lens. "Who am I?" the man asks. "Um, Evan? Are you ok?" asks the cameraman. "You ate that giant sub and then sat on the floor and fell asleep." The man, now realizing who he is and what his purpose is, exclaims, "Oh! That happened again? Sorry about that. We ready to shoot?" And so another episode of 90 Seconds began.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, March 4th, 2014
item.description: We know how excited everyone is about our new P3 adult lunchables, but the fun doesn't end there. Introducing the full lineup of Oscar Mayer manchild lunches! We took our classic Pizza Lunchables and created new Kale Pizza Lunchables. Next up, we have the Ham and American Sub Lunchable, but now we've added Grey Poupon mustard to it because that's something we think adults like. It's the same exact sandwich, but now it comes with a more mature spread. Lastly, we have our Chicken Strip Lunchables. We haven't actually changed these at all, but now the kit comes with a portable glass of Merlot. Simply put, you're going to love being an adult!

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, March 3rd, 2014
item.description: Okay, so here's the pitch. You'll be playing a lab technician for some super science-y place — lots of future stuff — and you'll accidentally be working late at night and fall into this cloning machine. And you'll come out as both you and then a dog version of you. But then the machine breaks down and government agents know you're the only key left so they're hunting you down. But! They're looking for you... and also a dog version of you. So you two argue it out — yes, of course the dog speaks English, it's a clone version of you — and you two decide to dress up the dog as a human and enroll it in college. But like, a sexy college full of beautiful people. So now you're in hiding at a nearby university while G-men with guns and sunglasses hunt you down. It'll be great! We start shooting in a month and the director was a camera operator who worked on the Fast and Furious series, which is great, because he knows his way around films and in fact we were thinking about calling this Fast and Furry-ous because, well duh, your name would be Kyle "Nine" Fast. Get it? K-9? Okay, so just sign here and let's make movie history!

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, February 26th, 2014
item.description: Adam Driver in final talks to play the villain in the new 'Star Wars' movie! David Fincher in early talks to direct the new Steve Jobs biopic! Now, Dieter Bohn is in middle, somewhat solid, but not enough to confirm talks play an undisclosed character in a new movie from a soon-to-be-announced high profile director. The film, set for release in 2026, will find Bohn's character faced with a difficult decision, one that will alter his life forever. Get ready for the feel-good-suspense-romcom-dramedy of the 2020's!

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, February 25th, 2014
item.description: Milk Inc. is sad to retire our classic "Got Milk?" campaign, but we are ecstatic about our new "Milk Life" slogan. However, that was not our original plan. Our first batch of catchphrases included "Milk, grab life by the teat," "Milk, the udder drink," "Milk, it's nipple juice," and "Milk, cookies not included."

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, February 20th, 2014
item.description: I may just be a lonely tech writer and occasional fan fiction fanatic, but damnit I want to be more! I want to stand atop a mountain, shouting at the top of my lungs. I want all who see me to know that I am Adi Robertson and I will not stand down. I am tech writer, hear me roar! Also, I would really love Google to give me billions of dollars.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, February 19th, 2014
item.description: What can you buy for $16 billion? That kind of money can get you 320,000 Tesla Model S cars, almost 64,002,560 copies of Titanfall Collector's Edition, 32,000,000,000 wings on half off wing night, 16 Instagrams in 2012, three years of making it rain in the club, and 329 Paul McCartney divorce settlements.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, February 13th, 2014
item.description: Adrianne Jeffries was not able to write a description for 90 Seconds on The Verge as she was too busy preparing all of her Valentine's Day plans. Don't worry, she totally had planned all of this a while ago, but now she just needs to oversee everything. For instance, her dinner plans include reservations at that restaurant. You know, that really good one. What's the name again? Either way, it's all going to be amazing.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, February 11th, 2014
item.description: From the studio that brought you the remake of 'RoboCop' and 'Grown Ups 2' comes this summer's biggest action blockbuster, 'RoboBlart: Mall Cop.' When Officer Alex Murphy is kicked off the force for aggressive behavior, he's sent to the second most dangerous place in Michigan, Twelve Oaks Mall. Featuring edge-of-your-seat action, non-stop suspense, and loads of Cinnabons, this is film you don't want to miss. Coming Summer 2014!

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, February 7th, 2014
item.description: We apologize for any errors you may have witnessed Adrianne Jeffries encounter today. To be completely honest, it's the end of the week and we're tired. So things didn't go exactly as we planned. Is it really that big of a problem? Come on! Why do you have to be like that? Why can't you just accept us the way we are? Whatever. Enjoy this episode. We'll see you on Monday.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, February 6th, 2014
item.description: Adi? Are you there? This is your bionic tooth, Denise. I am really worried about how quickly you are eating those pretzels. I can sense that at some point in the VERY near future, you are going to choke. Though it may simply be your destiny to choke to death on pretzels, I really think if you slowed down while consuming that bag of Rold Gold, you would have a much better chance of not dying. Please think about it. Please.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, February 5th, 2014
item.description: Greetings Verge 2014 friends! This is Ross Miller and I am writing to you from the year 2042. I am happy to announce that The Verge is still around and thriving in my world. Some things have changes though. For one, in 2033, Joshua Topolsky had his brain transferred into a robotic exoskeleton, making him the first sentient robot editor-in-chief. After the fall of New York City due to overpopulation in 2025, we moved the Verge office to Mars where we have since filled 50% of our staff with extraterrestrial beings. They're really nice. Also, in case anyone is wondering, Nilay Patel has replaced his blood with whiskey.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, February 4th, 2014
item.description: Unfortunately before we were able to let David know that a CEO was already chosen, he sent out the following letter to what he thought were his new employees at Microsoft: Hello everyone. My name is David Pierce and I am your new boss. I don't want to change too many things around the office, but I thought I would use this moment to announce some exciting news. First off, everyone must call me by my birth name, Chuck Bucklenuck. Secondly, Casual Fridays will now be limited to only hawaiian shirts. Finally, I will be changing the name of our company to 'Macrosoft.' I just want to try new things, ok? Anywho, thanks again for giving me this high paying job!

item.itunes:summary: Unfortunately before we were able to let David know that a CEO was already chosen, he sent out the following letter to what he thought were his new employees at Microsoft: Hello everyone. My name is David Pierce and I am your new boss. I don't want to change too many things around the office, but I thought I would use this moment to announce some exciting news. First off, everyone must call me by my birth name, Chuck Bucklenuck. Secondly, Casual Fridays will now be limited to only hawaiian shirts. Finally, I will be changing the name of our company to 'Macrosoft.' I just want to try new things, ok? Anywho, thanks again for giving me this high paying job!

item.description: We are only three days away from Super Bowl XLVIII and our tech writers are jazzed for the big game. Jacob Kastrenakes said, "Is that happening this Sunday?" while Adrianne Jeffries exclaimed, "That's football, right?" The energy is palpable, the competition is fierce, and The Verge is on football lockdown! Also, we made another episode of 90 Seconds on The Verge.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, January 28th, 2014
item.description:
On the series premiere of 'Doctor Who,' the Doctor and his companion Clara find themselves in a government run society where agencies tap into millions of citizens' phone records, computers, and even smartphone apps every day.
When the TARDIS is damaged during a routine wiretap (one the government, Torchwood, and U.N.I.T. all claim was to protect the safety of its citizens), the Doctor is forced to fix his prized machine before it's too late and he's forever stuck in this police state. Peter Capaldi also makes his debut in an outfit that makes the Doctor look like a magician from the 1920's.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, January 24th, 2014
item.description: Entry #11842: It has been a full eight minutes since the great blackout of Google+ and Gmail. No one could have predicted the catastrophic results of such an incident. Our service may be down, but our spirits are high… for now. Some say they heard there might be some Google down south. I find that hard to believe and if so, they don’t have enough Google for everyone. Our research team has been working tirelessly to find a cure, but our resources are scarce. We may have to switch back to Yahoo! Mail. If that is the case, God help us all.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, January 23rd, 2014
item.description: We are pleased to announce the release of 90 Seconds 2.1. With this update, we have fixed the rebooting issue that has plagued many viewers. The update also adds new features like smell-o-news, stabilization for off-road viewing, and the choice to watch the most recent episode with a tree as the host. We hope you enjoy these improvements!

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, January 21st, 2014
item.description: You can always count on the 90 Second news team to be there. Not snow, nor sleet, nor hail, nor acid rain, nor fire showers, nor apocalypse will stop our team from bringing you all the latest news. With people like news anchor Ross Miller or street reporter Ross Miller or even our executive editor-at-large Ross Miller, your family can feel safe knowing that Ross Miller has you covered.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, January 14th, 2014
item.description: If you could build a time machine, would you do it? If you could travel through space and time, would you do it? If you could alter the past, would you do it? If you could go back to that deli you went to for lunch today and not get that turkey club because the meat tasted funny, would you do it? Wouldn't it just be easier to take some Tums and then remember not to order that sandwich? Doesn't this seem like a massive waste of money?

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, January 9th, 2014
item.description: Hello? Is anybody out there? My name is Nathan Cykiert. I was filming a daily news show with my friend, Chris Ziegler. It's only 90 seconds long, but we still manage to cram the top stories of the day into it. Anyway, I think we made some sort of wrong turn because now we're a little lost. If anyone can hear me, could you direct us back to the Las Vegas Convention Center? That would be very helpful. Also, do you know where I could get a pastrami sandwich around here?

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, January 7th, 2014
item.description: Are you there God? It's Me, 1080p. I've been pretty down lately. I mean, I used be hip. I used to popular. Ok, I'm being a little overdramatic. I'm sorry. It's just that no one is talking about me anymore. These days, people only care about 4K. Ugh, what kind of name is that anyway? 4K? It just doesn't flow off the tongue like 1080p. I sound so much more bold and magical! Anyway, I hope you're enjoying CES and I'll talk to you when you get back.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, January 6th, 2014
item.description: You hop on your dune buggy, start the engine, and head deep into the desert. Your skin dries and cracks as the sun's rays hit your face. As your mouth dries and your head feels funny, you begin to wonder if you're ever going to make it. Just as hope begins to dwindle, you see it. The bright lights, the disgusting amount of people, and the overabundance of 4K products. You park your buggy, brush the sand off your hoodie, and smile. You have arrived at CES 2014.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, December 19th, 2013
item.description: Introducing the Lego Airplane... turn that frown upside down when you build a commercial airliner in your own backyard! With the proper adult supervision, children can now build and customize a 747 with lego bricks. Once complete, these little aviation workers can actually take to the skies in their new creation. Don't forget to build that landing gear! Every set comes with 580,000,000,000,000,000,000 bricks, two pilots, and a functioning drink cart (beverages not included). Make the holidays soar with the Lego Airplane!

With the proper adult supervision, children can now build and customize a 747 with lego bricks. Once complete, these little aviation workers can actually take to the skies in their new creation. Don't forget to build that landing gear! Every set comes with 580,000,000,000,000,000,000 bricks, two pilots, and a functioning drink cart (beverages not included). Make the holidays soar with the Lego Airplane!

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, November 18th, 2013
item.description: In Michael Moore's latest controversial documentary, he takes an inside look into the never-before-told story of Dieter Bohn on Election Night 2012. For the first time ever, viewers will see how one man spent his presidential evening. Prepare to be shocked, prepare to be engaged, prepare to enter the Bohn Zone. 'Dieter: The Dieter Bohn Story.'

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, December 17th, 2013
item.description: Hello. It appears you're trying to enroll in our healthcare program. Would you like some help? Perhaps I can direct you to a specialist for that headache you are getting after staring at error screens on our website. No? You're all set? Well if you need anything, just ask for Clippy. Why am I a paperclip and not something medical related? I don't know. People loved me on Office, but I don't think it's translating well to this site.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, December 16th, 2013
item.description: The year is 2082. The Resistance, lead by our great leader, Steven Ballmer, has lost its most recent battle against the robotic army of Google. The machines are simply too fast, too strong, and too Android-y. We may have lost the battle, but we shall not lose this war. We must always remember the words of our mighty captain. "RESISTANCE RESISTANCE RESISTANCE RESISTANCE RESISTANCE RESISTANCE RESISTANCE RESISTANCE RESISTANCE RESISTANCE RESISTANCE RESISTANCE RESISTANCE RESISTANCE RESISTANCE RESISTANCE!!!!!!"

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, December 13, 2013
item.description: We are sad to announce that after filming of today's episode commenced, Nathan Cykiert was killed. He was leaving the '90 Seconds on The Verge' studio when a black cat ran out from under a desk, scaring Nathan and causing him to lose his balance. He attempted to catch himself, but instead smashed into a mirror, shattering it. Glass was everywhere as people ran to help Nathan, but it was too late. He had already picked himself back up and was going to grab a broom to clean up the mess he made. As he opened the maintenance closet, natural causes kicked in and Nathan died.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, December 12, 2013.mp4
item.description: And the nominees for 'Best Actor on a News Show Under Two Minutes That Also Makes Pop Culture Jokes and References or Musical' are: Ross Miller in '90 Seconds on The Verge,' Leonardo DiCaprio in 'The Wolf of Wall Street,' Skeleton in the Halloween episode of '90 Seconds on The Verge,' the Horsehead Killer in '90 Seconds on The Verge,' and Oscar Isaac in 'Inside Llewyn Davis.'

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, December 11th, 2013
item.description: Love watching musicals break out in the middle of food courts? How about 100+ people freezing at the same time in Grand Central? Well if you love Flash Mobs, you're gonna love Flash Jobs! We take everyday, ordinary people with boring jobs and put them in high-stress, high salary positions... for only TEN MINUTES! Watch as your Average Joe becomes your Billionaire Joe and then back to your Average Joe. Coming next year to TLC!

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, December 10th, 2013
item.description: He's battled the Black Pearl, recovered the heart of Davy Jones, been to the world's end, and fought Blackbeard. He then took on local government to get a proper boating license, went to physical therapy for his chronic arthritis, and opened a stamp shop. Now Jack Sparrow is back and he's battling a whole new beast — the Digital Millennium Copyright Act. Get ready for 'Pirates of the Caribbean VIII: Pirate Bay Island.'

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, November 10th, 2013
item.description: "Hello fellow player. I love playing the World of Warcraft with you. Remember that time those wolves attacked us? That was so fun. You were making jokes about "going all terrorist on their ass." That was hilarious. What is your home address? I want to send you a gift because we are friends. I am not a spy. I love this game."

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, December 6th, 2013
item.description: "I am so excited about 'X-Men: Days of Future Past' and now the newly announced 'X-Men: Apocalypse' that I just had to take this time to announce the next films in the series. Coming in 2018, fans can see 'X-Men: Post Apocalyptic Cleanup Time.' This will of course be followed by back-to-back films in late 2019 and early 2020 called 'X-Men: Can't The Avengers Take This One?' and 'X-Men: If We Must.' Finally, in 2024, the X-Men film everyone is waiting for will hit theaters. Get ready for 'X-Men: Based on the Story Push By Sapphire.'" —@BryanSinger

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, December 5th, 2013
item.description: "Hello customer #11864. Welcome to Applebee's, America's favorite bar and restaurant. Can I interest you in a delicious appetizer from our kitchen? We have a special today on JERK CHICKEN WINGS WITH DIPPING SAUCES. I will leave you now and come back with some human beverages. You are our favorite slave, I mean customer."

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, December 2nd, 2013
item.description: "Look! Up there, in the sky! It's a bird, it's a plane, no, it's Superman! Wait, it's not him either. What is that? It looks like some sort of remote controlled helicopter. What's that it's carrying and why is it coming towards my apartment? Is that the underwear I ordered on Amazon?"

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, November 26th, 2013
item.description: "Gobble, gobble. This is the Verge's official turkey. I just wanted to let you know that 90 Seconds will be taking the rest of the week off to try and hunt me down. I've been able to safely evade them until now, but Ross is becoming a better hunter by the day. This really looked like more fun in 'The Hunger Games.' Anyway, they'll be back next Monday with more 90 Seconds on the V–" "Got him! I'll be eatin' well this Thanksgiving!"

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, November 25th, 2013
item.description: "Hi, this is Patricia calling from 23andMe. I'm calling because you recently tested yourself with our product. I believe your results may differ from your actual health. Remember when we diagnosed you with 12 fingers on your left hand? We believe that may have been a false positive. If you could do us a favor and check your left hand and give us a call back with a new finger count, we would greatly appreciate it. Once again, we apologize for any inconvenience and we hope to hear from you soon."

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, November 22nd, 2013
item.description: In the case of Awkward Guy v. Friend Zone, we, the jury, find the defendant guilty of wimping out on that kiss last Friday night. We feel that the defendant had his chance after him and Jessica finished watching '10 Things I Hate About You.' There was a moment where it totes seemed like the right time, but then the defendant was all like, "I don't know what to do. What if she says no? That would be so embarrassing." And Jessica was all, "I guess he isn't interested in being more than friends." The crime shall be punishable by a minimum of ten years of regret.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, November 21st, 2013
item.description: Tired of reading books about vampires? Looking to save time and brain power by simply watching them on TV? Well FX is here to save the day. Introducing 'The Strain,' the TV show! No longer will you have to settle for paper and text. Now all those juicy, vampire words will come to life on the silver screen. You can even watch it on an airplane! "How am I supposed to share my excitement over each episode with my friends if I'm on a plane?" Well now you can watch 'The Strain' on a plane and gossip with your friends on the phone at the same time! Think it will annoy everyone around you? Sure, but who cares? It's legal now!

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, November 20th, 2013
item.description: Hey, how are you doing? I just wanted to let you know that I had an amazing time with you today. I really feel like we had something. I mean the sparks were really flying! Do you believe in love at first sight? Maybe I'm getting ahead of myself, but I haven't felt like this in years. Hopefully we can do this again sometime very soon. — Nathan

What is this description really for anyway? What are these weird quotes? Who comes up with these questions that they throw in here? Does anyone even read this? I give up. I don't know what I'm doing here. What am I going to write for this description? Oh wait... I believe I just did it.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, November 18th, 2013

item.description: Just a small town girl, living in a lonely universe. She took the midnight space train goin' anywhere light-years away. Just a city boy, born and raised in south Detroit 2 on Mars. He took the midnight space train goin' anywhere light-years away.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, November 14th, 2013
item.description: "We just love what your startup is doing!" "Thank you so much." "We feel that it would make a beautiful addition to the Facebook family." "You do?" "We do. That is why we are willing to give you $80,000,000,000,000,000 plus this batch of delicious chocolate cookies my wife made. What do you say?" "Mmmmm... I think I'll wait a bit to see if I can get more. Thanks though! Can I still take a cookie?"

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, November 12th, 2013
item.description: Come one, come all to the greatest spectacle you've ever laid eyes on! For behind that curtain is a world of mystery and magic, mysticism and wonder, oddity and intrigue. I know many of you have traveled a great distance to make it to the Michigan State Fairgrounds, but I do promise you the wait will be worth it. Ladies and gentlemen, boys and girl, I present to you, one of the great enigmas of the modern world. For no advancement in technology will help us better understand what it is that lies before us. Without further ado, I give you a truly audacious reveal and one that will live in your hearts and minds for the rest of your lives. Please put your hands together and help me welcome... *cough* I'm sorry, but my throat is a little dry from talking. Let me grab a glass of water to sooth my parched mouth and then I shall return!

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, November 11th, 2013
item.description:
Rumor has it Apple is working on a TV set...that can also dispense Reese's Pieces.
Rumor has it the NSA loves spying...on baby zebras.
Rumor has it Google's next tablet will be called...the Googablet.
Rumor has it Disney is creating a new amusement park...that will only serve sliced cucumbers for food.
Rumor has it the Bronx is looking to secede from New York...and create a new city called New New York.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, November 8th, 2013
item.description: Here are the facts: A body on the floor of Studio B. His neck appears to be broken. One polaroid picture. Who still uses this analog technology? Three news stories from the day. All are presented in 90 seconds. One confused host. He will solve this mystery before the day is done.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, November 7th, 2013
item.description: A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away, news shows went on for way too long. Anchors lost their voices, cameramen had to pee really badly, and viewers grew bored. Long story short, some guys from The Verge got together and decided to cut the show down to 90 seconds. And so became this show...

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, November 6th, 2013
item.description: It is with great sadness that we announce the passing of Blockbuster video rental stores. In the era of VHS and DVD, Blockbuster was king. No night was complete without running up to the neighborhood store and picking up a copy of 'Mulan' and some chocolate covered cookie dough. Blockbuster is survived by its streaming rental service. The company will be buried in the same cemetery as Hollywood Video.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, November 5th, 2013
item.description: The Fifth of November is an important day to remember, but not because of Guy Fawkes Day. This date holds a special place in my heart. I shall never forget that evening in November of 1999. The N64 controller was practically slipping from my hands from the constant flow of sweat seeping from my palms. This was hour eight of Mario Party and I had yet to beat my fellow players in the fishing game. The center of my palm turned bloody and raw from reeling in my line. Alas, this was the final mini game of the night. My eyes turned bloodshot as the sugar rush I had previously been feeling faded. However at the last minute, I managed to find my courage from deep within my being as I cast out my line towards the treasure chest. Reel. Reel. Reel. I clenched my teeth and held back tears as I pulled my prize in. 3...2...1. At the final second, I pulled my gold ashore and reveled in all its glory. I was a winner.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, November 4th, 2013
item.description:
Coming next summer, from the studio that brought you 'The Avengers' and 'Thor: The Dark World' comes the most anticipated movie of the decade....
It's 'The Hunger Games' starring Jennefire Lawrence and Al Roker. After being sent to the Capitol to report on a nasty storm, Al Roker gets swept up into the world of Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark. Critics can't stop talking about the film, saying, "I really just wanted to watch the original film, but downloaded this by accident," and asking "isn't that the weatherman from the Today show?"

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, November 1st, 2013
item.description:
"This is Major Tom to Ground Control, I'm stepping through the door and..."
"This is Ground Control to Major Tom, um, you've reached Mach 6 so you should not be opening any doors."
"I'm floating in the most peculiar way. And the stars look very different today."
"Tom! Stop messing around up there!"

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, October 31st, 2013
item.description: On Day Four, the office found themselves in a period of mourning. A somber production staff tried their best to continue with their day-to-day work. Surprisingly, the lone editor continued his work as his deadline was fast approaching and he was already in hot water with his boss. If he can get his work done in time, it will truly be a happy Halloween.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, October 30th, 2013
item.description: On Day Three, things took a turn for the worse. Despite protective measures taken to ensure the health and safety of the lone editor, we were unable to cure him of his...stomach bug. He will be greatly missed. We would also like to take this time to put to rest the rumors that this was some sort of "outbreak" or "infection." That is preposterous. This was simply a really bad stomach bug. That is all.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, October 29th, 2013
item.description: On Day Two, things started to get a little weirder. The lone editor's vision grew hazy, his palms clammy. Perhaps this is something more than a typical bug. I mean, the cough is getting a little....worse. He does seem to be losing some weight. Maybe he just needs to get more fruit and vegetables in his system. Hopefully he'll feel better tomorrow.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, October 28th, 2013
item.description: On Day 1, the side effects began. Although not so severe at first, the lone editor knew something worse was coming. Was it the new migraine medication he began taking over the weekend? Perhaps it's just a flu. He calmed down, reminding himself that he spent time with a friend over the weekend who was getting over a cold. Yeah, that must be it. Hopefully the editor feels better tomorrow. Hopefully.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, October 25th, 2013
item.description:
Tired of your old, expensive cable packages? Not interested in the 400 hundred channels that you get? Looking for an à la carte option? Try The Verge TV bundle!
You get: -6 cable channels. Do you really need any more? -Nilay Channel: 24 hours of Nilay ranting about wireless carriers -Ross Miller Channel: 24 hours of Ross Miller doing aerobics -Hit original content such as, 'iOS vs. Android: Does it really matter?' and '90 Seconds on 90 Seconds on The Verge: the 90 Second Story'

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, October 22nd, 2013
item.description: You wanted thinner? We made it thinner...WAY thinner. How thin you ask? You know what a pencil looks like? Thinner! Ever held a Wheat Thin? It's thinner than that! Remember Listerine PocketPaks? No, it's not that thin. Actually, the Wheat Thin example might have been a bit of an overstatement, but it's still pretty gosh darn thin. Let's just go with the pencil example.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, October 18th, 2013
item.description: Hoping to become the superhero we all need, Elon Musk has acquired a number of James Bond's gadgets, but he customized them with his own flavor. First up was the garotte watch. Musk purchased it for $1,200, but put another $18,000 in it so that the watch could shoot flames. Next were the dagger shoes. The shoes are traditional black leather and cost roughly $800, but Musk spent another $50,000 to make them shoot flames, plus another $30,000 on insurance. Lastly, Musk bought the original Golden Gun for $80,000, but unfortunately broke it while trying to make the gun shoot flames.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, October 15th, 2013
item.description:
Burger King. Covered in slime. Steve Ballmer wearing a diaper. Giant cockroaches in tuxedos. Everyone speaks spanish while 'That's Amore' by Dean Martin plays on repeat. The air thickens to a point where I cannot move. Ballmer closes in on me.
I really need to stop drink Mountain Dew before bed.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, October 14th, 2013
item.description: He was there to bring funk to the force. After all, this department was lacking the charisma, charm, and soul of its early days. Some called this move risky, bizarre, even stupid, but Captain Fatone knew what he was doing. That's why he hired Detective Timberlake in the first place.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, October 10th, 2013
item.description:
"Your group makes its way to the entrance to the dark woods. Your elven archer is still poisoned and will soon require a special plant from the forest as an antidote. No one in your party knows exactly what plant."
"Can I leave the archer behind and sign with one of the top two soda companies as a creative director and spokesperson for a comfortable six figures annually."
[Checks book]
"You need to roll a six."

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, October 9th, 2013
item.description:
"You drive a tough bargain, but I'll give you one final offer."
"What is it?"
"I'll give $750,000,000 for one and a half more episodes of The Golden Girls WITH hologram Bea Arthur"
"I still don't understand why you love The Golden Girls so much Mr. Branson, but I cannot turn down that offer. Sold!"

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, October 2nd, 2013
item.description:
"Yo. You got the stuff?"
"Yeah. You got the money?"
"$5.50, right?"
"Yep."
"That seems a bit steep."
"If you don't want this, I got like six other people waiting-"
"No, I do. I'll take it. This stuff is good?"
"It's not just good. It's the best. Those are fresh walnuts."
"They do look good. Ok, I'll take one pint of Chunky Monkey please.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, September 27th, 2013
item.description: No description was written as the entire Verge staff left to go get pad thai after referencing it in today's episode. A description was then supposed to be written after said pad thai was eaten, but during dinner, an argument erupted over Star Trek Into Darkness. In the end, hurtful words were said and friendships were broken. Also, a table and some chairs were damaged in the altercation. We'll be back Monday with more 90 Seconds.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, September 19th, 2013
item.description: I'm going to create a restaurant called 'TGI THURSDAY' because people really don't appreciate this day as much as they should. Think about it — it's the day before the day before the weekend. You can plan out what crazy adventures you're about to get yourself into or dream about the dreams you'll be having on your couch while you watch a marathon of 'The Adventures of Pete & Pete'. Thursday marks the accomplishment of the near completion of the work week and dammit it deserves an reward! Also, I'd love to serve my kickin' sweet and sour chicken wings.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, September 18th, 2013
item.description:
If you plant a seed, you can grow a tree.
If you grow a tree, you can collect apples.
If you collect apples, you can make pie.
If you make pie, you can create a business.
If you create a business, you can work long hours.
If you work long hours, you can find yourself away from home.
If you are away from home, you can not clean the house.
If you don't clean the house, you can attract rodents.
If you attract rodents, you can find your house taken over by human-like mice.
If you find your house taken over by human-like mice, you can battle the mice army for control of your property.
If you battle the mouse army, you can die.
Planting seeds will lead to your inevitable death.

"Perhaps it was just a hiccup?"
"Have we been compromised?"
"No, no, no. This is something else. Something...different."
"It's repeating again, captain."

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, September 13th, 2013
item.description:
She was very cautious as she headed to work. This was no typical Friday.
"Meow," said the black cat that crossed her path.
"I'm working here!" said the construction worker whose ladder she walked under.
"Get your mirror out of my apartment!" said the woman throwing her ex-boyfriend's stuff out the window.
"Check out my new umbrella," said the man opening up his umbrella in the lobby of her office.
She made it to her desk safely. A grin grew on her face as she reveled in her accomplishment. Just to be safe, she threw one handful of salt over her shoulder...it was pepper. She grabbed the wrong bag this morning.
"Uh oh..." said the woman.

item.description: His stylish print made him the perfect finishing touch. The cherry on top. He was sleek. Sexy. Real. Teasing the camera all day, he knew how to work it. How to stand out, but not take complete focus. He was Ross Miller's tie.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, September 9th, 2013
item.description:
"He arrived knowing nothing of himself. Who is he? Soon he will know. Because what begins at the water shall end there...and what ends there shall once more begin. This is what happens. Men become lost. Men vanish. Men are erased. And rebo-"
"I'm sorry to interrupt, but I'm really in a rush. I just want to know how to get to I-75."

What happens when a goof goes too far? What happens when a fun little prank turns into a night of sheer terror?
From the acclaimed author of 'Yep, It's Poop' and 'Little House on the Prarie II' comes the new face of evil.
Coming this winter... 'Blood Wedgie'

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, August 28th, 2013
item.description:
"What is a symptom of a technological illness?"
*man waits to hear the answer*
"A hacking cough."
*silence*
"HACKING cough... a HACKING cough."
*head shake*
"Get it? Like it has two meanings."
*man exits room*

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, August 26th, 2013
item.description: If I had the ability to fly, I don't know if I would use it that often. I just wouldn't want to show off. Who wants to hang out with the guy that's all, "Hey! Look at me! I'm the guy who can fly!" I mean, really? You really have to show off to everyone that you can do something no one else can? I guess I'd rather just have the ability to fall asleep quickly. Maybe that will finally stop my insomnia.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, August 22nd, 2013
item.description:
The tension is palpable. No purchases being made, nothing sold. What to do? The whole world is watching. Sweat trickles down the foreheads of everyone in the room. They all stare at the anxious IT guy called in to fix the problem.
Control. Alt. Delete.
Problem solved.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, August 20th, 2013
item.description:
"Hey, smart guy. I thought I told you not to eat lunch around here."
"I'm... I'm just minding my own business."
"I don't think so, kid. Stop stalling. Hand it over."
"I don't have any lunch money. I brought lunch from home."
"Not the money, kid. I want the hard drives."

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, August 19th, 2013
item.description: He arrived not knowing what flavor of frozen drink he wanted. Soon he will know. Because what begins at the convenience store shall end there. And what ends there, shall once more begin. This is what happens. Men become thirsty. Men get lost. Men order that strange blue flavor when what they really want is the cola and cherry combination. Men's taste buds... are reborn.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, August 16th, 2013
item.description: The boy came prepared, his pockets stuffed with quarters and that powder that rock climbers use to keep their palms dry. He approached the machine confidently, but with caution. "Step forward and face me," said the machine. The boy reached into his pocket, hand quivering, and grabbed his first coin. It felt smooth and dirty. This wasn't the quarter's first rodeo. The boy took one single deep breath, taking in the smell of cotton candy and forgotton dreams that lingered in the dark corners of Pinball Pete's. He exhaled slowly, but confidently. This was no longer a boy. This was a man. A man ready to finally beat a game that had destroyed many saturday afternoons when he probably should have been doing something more physically active. And so he dropped the quarter into the slot and the game began.

"Just don't talk to Gary. He nearly had a breakdown working on his scent wheel."
"What was the assignment?"
"The Warthog."

item.description:
"Hamburgers! The cornerstone of any nutritious breakfast. What kind of hamburgers?"
"Cheeseburgers."
"No, no, no. Where'd you get 'em? McDonald's, Wendy's, Jack in the Box; where?"
"Maastricht University."
"Maastricht University! That's that stem cell burger joint. I hear they got some tasty burgers!"
item.media:title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, August 6th, 2013
item.media:description:
"Hamburgers! The cornerstone of any nutritious breakfast. What kind of hamburgers?"
"Cheeseburgers."
"No, no, no. Where'd you get 'em? McDonald's, Wendy's, Jack in the Box; where?"
"Maastricht University."
"Maastricht University! That's that stem cell burger joint. I hear they got some tasty burgers!"

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, August 5th, 2013
item.description:
Sure, he had it in his Wish List, but that doesn't mean he was going to buy it. Adding stuff there was just something you did when you couldn't make up your mind. Take Larry for instance; he'd added that LA paper to his years ago.
But there it was. Today's Lightning Deal. The timer clicked down...
Jeff hit "Add to Cart."

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, August 2nd, 2013
item.description: Car A leaves Albuquerque, NM at 4:10PM, driving towards Bakersfield, CA in a straight line at 72 miles per hour. Car B leaves Bakersfield 36 minutes later, traveling at 81 miles per hour. Assuming these speeds are constant, at what time does the driver of Car A realize he'd really rather spend his weekend somewhere else?

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, July 30th, 2013
item.description:
"And just like that, they were gone. Nobody ever saw them again."
The 6-year-old's eyes opened wide. "Where did they go?"
"Someplace magical. Someplace we can never find. To the space between the spaces."
"Really? That's the best you can do?"

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, July 25th, 2013
item.description: You put your left foot in. You put your left foot out. You put your left foot in. And then your calf starts cramping because you haven't been drinking enough water and, wow, this really hurts. Your parents warned you about the importance of hydration, but noooo, you didn't listen because you just thought you had all the answers.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, July 23rd, 2013
item.description:
Never take your eye off the card. I want you to keep looking right here! Whether I do this — whether I do that — I want you to keep your attention focused, right here. Don't let me distract you, and don't be fooled by my associate to the right. I'm going to play this straight with you, you're going to see the card you've selected, right here, you're going to see it jump from one hand to the other, all within the blink of an eye. Are you ready? Shall we do this? One... two... three...
Go.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, July 17th, 2013
item.description: "Because it's the inexplicable animal-weather hybrid that New York City deserves, but not the one it needs right now. So we'll attack it with chainsaws. Because it can take it. Because it's not our hero. It's a loud, vicious force of destruction, a bizarro phenomenon. A shark knight... tornado. Two. The sequel."

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, July 15th, 2013
item.description:
In the ocean depths, the ancient creature stirred. Born not of this world, but another, distant land — an ashen hellscape of fiery retribution. It waited for eons in the cold pressure, adjusting to its new environment and gathering strength. Knowing that one day the call would sound for it to reveal itself to humanity.
And it would heed that call.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, July 11th, 2013
item.description:
"It's tough being a spy. You can't trust anybody, your friends double-cross you. Your boss is always saying you're too old to do this, or that."
He sighed. "And everybody thinks they know what your favorite drink is."

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, July 10th, 2013
item.description:
Pressure mounted. Sweat beaded on his brow. He knew he had to make a decision, one that could impact not just himself but the future of those around him. His entire life; lessons learned since childhood, moral codes laid out in texts as old as humankind... it all led up to this. This one single, solitary decision that could change his fate forever.
He took the last sugar packet.

item.description:
"Well that's odd."
"What?"
"That. The shimmering blue doorway in the middle of the office."
"Oh, you mean the time portal. Don't worry. That's here every Tuesday."

item.description: Take away the celebration, the gusto, the congratulatory back-slaps and and the fat cats with the expensive cigars, and you're left with just one thing. That unrelenting, never-ending desire that is only sated by two words: it's showtime.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, July 2nd, 2013
item.description:
Everything had suddenly gone quiet. He cocked his head, listening. No music from upstairs. No fireworks or shouting from the lake outside. The cabin was just... still. "Hello?"
He stood up. "Okay you guys, come on," he said to the empty room. "I know what you're doing. This is the scene where the guy who's gone up to the cabin with his four friends suddenly realizes that the horrible creature has taken them all, right? And then like six seconds later it throws open the front door and comes after him. C'mon... try to be a little more creative, would ya?"
The Horrible Creature opened the front door. "You don't have to be so harsh. I'm doing the best I can."

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, July 1st, 2013
item.description:
The atmospheric deflector was struggling. Rattling hard, real gonzo. Everybody knew that coming in for a landing on Trodinia-12 was no picnic, but this was ridiculous.
"You might want to buckle up," I called back to the passengers. "This is gonna get real."

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Friday, June 28th, 2013
item.description:
I couldn't believe it. After all the confusion, the deception... could this nasty turnabout be true? Was this the person that had been testing us all along?
"I... I don't understand."
The killer snorted. "Of couse not. Of course you don't 'understand.' You don't have the capacity. Do you know how simple it was to concoct this scenario? Oh, it should have been much harder. Much harder, indeed. But for you lot..."
The killer trailed off, then smiled. "For you lot it took all of 90 seconds to seal your fate."

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, June 27th, 2013
item.description:
Having dinner with a stranger is awkward enough. Try doing it with three murdered partygoers in the drawing room.
I studied the guest at the other end of the table. He wasn't big on eye contact. Still... there was something familiar about him. I just couldn't place it.
At least the soup was good.

item.description:
And then there were three.
The latest crime was accompanied by yet another note. "By now you may have surmised the predicament you find yourselves in," the butler read. "This evening did not happen by chance, and you are not the strangers you might think."
I traded glances with the other guests. I knew what kind of people they were, but had I met them? Not that I could remember.
"There is a connection amongst all of you," he said. "Discovering it is your only hope of escaping this house alive."

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Tuesday, June 25th, 2013
item.description:
There was panic.
But really, what would you expect when one of the guests was found murdered? The reaction was normal. The things we discovered soon after, however, were not. The fact that the doors were locked. That the cars had been sent away. That none of us remaining would be able to leave the residence for the evening.
"It is raining quite hard outside," the butler said. That detail was of little significance, but the note in his hand was another matter. It was a new message from our mystery host.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, June 24th, 2013
item.description:
We arrived at the house, the lot of us invited by a host that still hadn't seen fit to reveal his — or her — identity. A simple card, written in a careful hand, and delivered by personal messenger. That was the only communication any of us had received.
As we milled in the hall, I looked at the other guests. Each of them striking in their own way, with easy smiles and guarded eyes. The eyes of people with secrets. This was going to be a most intriguing evening.

item.description:

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Monday, June 10th, 2013
item.description:
It had been hours and... nothing. Quiet enough that it was starting to feel that this was going to be another mission that led nowhere. He'd had too many of those. Too many in a file that was slowly growing thick with assignments, but no successes.
That's when the radio crackled next to him. Tape started to roll. Contact.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Thursday, June 6th, 2013
item.description:
It began like any other weekend day. A comforting breakfast, a leisurely stroll, and a late lunch at that restaurant near Monroe Street. Little did we know that things were about to change. That evolution and science had teamed up for a twist that would change the fate of humanity as we knew it.
Little did we know that this would be the day of the zombie pigeon invasion.

item.title: 90 Seconds on The Verge: Wednesday, June 5th, 2013
item.description: He opened the cabinet. Inside was a garden. A tiny garden, to be sure, but a garden nonetheless. Miniature patches of miniature sunflowers beamed over a miniature tomato plant. Nearby a miniature stream trickled softly down a miniature bed of rocks and soil. And there, tending the gardens, was a miniature man. And not just any man. A man with his own face.
